Our room was not large, but was perfect for two people and with the new windows and doors to our balcony, quite soundproof, although you can hear the street enough to know you're in the greatest city in the world. The rooms have been renovated with new flooring and the beds were comfortable, to me at least. We also had a mini fridge and a small tv. The washroom was okay, but not exciting. Our rooms were cleaned every day with new sheets and towels, etc. Breakfast was included in our package and was great, i.e. croissants, cheese, cereal, coffee, orange juice, etc. and the fellow who runs the show is very pleasant. The elevator is typical in Paris in that it's tiny and basically there's room for one person with one bag. Two people dance cheek to cheek without bags. My only complaint - and this wasn't a huge deal, would be their Internet was hopeless. We couldn't get connected wirelessly in our room and it was spotty in the lobby as they were having problems with their setup. This may be worked out now as they were quite concerned about it working properly. There's free Internet down the street at McDonald's anyway. All in all it's a great place to stay. It seemed very safe and I have no problem recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the rough.”
Reviews.Author: jeannei
Reviews.Content: Dear Paul et al, I just wanted you to know what a wonderful time we had staying at the Claude Bernard. Your staff was very helpful and friendly, the room(s) were comfortable and bright and the balcony provided us with a lovely view. We look forward to visiting you again. Thank you for everything. Jeanne Ingram, USA Giuseppe Platania, Italy

Reviews.Title: “wonderful weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 1815Ireland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location close to metro and the centre of paris. the staff at reception were very good and helped with directions and general advice. The room was big by Paris standards, we had a twin,and very comfortable.The bathroom had a bath and the room lighting was very good. The hotel experience we had ensured out enjoyment of Paris and a great weekend. Looking forward to going back again

Reviews.Title: “A honest hotel with attendant staff very friendly”
Reviews.Author: JABCarvalho
Reviews.Content: The hotel met expectations. Breakfast honest. Staff speaking English and very friendly and kind. Although my room was a front one it was not noisy because of the sound proof window. It's one block from the metro and is at one of the most important point of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: writerteacher001
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at the beginning of March. I had a single, which was understandably small, but I saw many of the other rooms as well, including the triples on the first floor that are accessible to the disabled, and the family rooms. As for my single, it had a double bed and I slept very well. Nothing fancy, but there was a functional desk of rustic style, and good sized wardrobe, and an ensuite shower/w.c. The shower was small, as expected in an old building coverted to ensuite units, but the use of a curtain instead of doors made it more comfortable than the hotels that use those folding doors. Some of the other rooms that I saw had bathtubs and larger bathrooms. The hotel is very well located. Two metro stops are within easy walking distance. The Musee Cluny is a few blocks away. Several main bus lines run past it, or nearby. Many restaurants are in the area (go down to rue St. Germain and eat at Twickenhams for a good inexpensive meal), as are all the amenities you could need. Most rooms have a refridgerator. Most also have room safes. If yours does not, there are extra safes in a room on the first floor that you can use. The hotel was pretty full when I was there, and the hot water held out for me even so. I had no complaints at all about cleanliness, and I am picky. Towels were changed daily. The hotel is always being maintained. The rooms appear freshly decorated, and not at all worn. The desks are deliberately country/rustic, not worn and nicked. They painted the reception area while I was there, in the evenings, and it did not even look like it needed painting to me. The staff at the desk are extremely helpful and willing to give directions on how to get to various places. I even called while I was out once to get directions. The staff went out of their way to check our plane times, and to find out the status of the train to the airport, and when one metro line was being shut for maintenance, etc. I can not speak too highly of them. Some of the rooms have great charm. The family rooms in particular are very large, and the ones on the second and fifth floor have walk out balconies (as do all the rooms facing the street on those floors.) I also faced the street, but was not bothered by street noise. I had some young people in the room next to mine a few nights, and while I could hear them talking it was not as if the walls were thin. They were very young and they talked a bit louder than adults is why I heard them. The breakfast room in in the basement, but it is a typical tourist class hotel breakfast room. The croissant and baguettes were fresh, the coffee not bad, the bit of cheese welcome. It is a continental breakfast and more than adequate on that count. There is also cereal and yogurt. If you want eggs etc, go to the above mentioned Twickenhams on your way out and about. It is getting harder to find hotels in the big cities that are managed by owners instead of hired staff, but this one appears to be. There is pride of ownership very visible here, in my opinion. No chipping plaster or paint, inside or out. No walls showing years of cigarette smoke. If you have been in a tired tourist hotel in Europe, you know what I mean. This one is not like that. It is an independent hotel, not too large, with a very European feel to it. A few quirks here and there, but that is how you know you are not in a Hilton or Day's Inn. Paris has those if you want them. As indicated in other reviews, the lift is tiny. Two people max, without luggage. Put the bags in and walk up to meet them if you can. Otherwise take it slowly, one person and luggage at a time. Most people walk the stairs, though, and I never had a long wait for the elevator when I needed to use it. One complaint, and one only. The wifi is unreliable. It is weak and spotty. I am not sure it is the hotel's issue or that of the network they are on.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: dalec1980
Reviews.Content: Very dissapointed with this hotel- and like the previous reviewer, im surprised with the positive reviews. We paid 180 Euros for a triple room, which we found was really a double room with a camp bed wheeled in. Ive stayed in Paris many times before and expected the room to be small- but even this was very very short of space. The room was pretty dirty and had more of a hostel feel to it, stains and marks on all bed linen and furntitue. When we checked in the previous guest had checked out and left behing all of their clothing in the wardrobe - which was a nice surprise. Im afraid to say its not a nice place to stay.............

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful small hotel in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: thefireknight
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris together and it was also my companion's birthday which happens to fall on St Valentine's day. Expectations were high for our 5 day, 4 night stay at Hotel Claude Bernard Paris and they didn't disappoint, the staff, especially Mamoun were fantastic. As you could imagine never having been to Parigi i was constantly asking Mamoun for recommendations and every time he was right on the money. Our room which I believe was #336 was a corner room with a view of the Avenue and the College of France. The room was well maintained and most importantly spotless, a real pleasure to retire to after a long day or night out on the town. It would be impossible to count how many good restaurants are in the immediate area, we tried two different one's each day. For my companion's birthday we went to Le Coupe Chou which is right around the corner from the hotel. Excellent French and continental cusine in understated elegant dining rooms with fireplaces though a bit pricey due to the Valentine's day menu which was 80 euro plus wine. Also around another corner was a very nice but very small Thai restaurand named Lo' which is definately worth trying if you like Thai food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff with a great location in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: kakers1689
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Claude Bernard for the month of January with students from my French class. The staff was accommodating and friendly and made us feel right at home. My birthday fell on one of our first days there, and the staff surprised me with a breakfast party with pastries from the bakery and a crown for me to wear in honor of my celebration! They even gave me a message from my parents wishing me a happy birthday. One of the best parts of staying at the hotel was the wonderful breakfasts each morning. After receiving a warm welcome from the workers as we came down, we were able to choose from cereals, croissants, rolls, juices, coffee, etc. The rooms were kept clean every day by the staff, and they were available to help us should we need any assistance with finding a good restaurant, the nearest place to buy a phone card, or even to get an extra cot for our room. If ever returning to Paris, I would make sure to stay at this hotel again! Wonderful, safe location, great staff, clean rooms, what more could a traveler want?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CeeBee125
Reviews.Content: Charming, friendly, safe, clean, and wholly likable hotel. Good breakfast (continental, nice variety). Wonderful location on Rue des Ecoles, with a short walk to Boulevard St. Michel, Notre Dame, and several Metro stops. In the evening, you can walk to an astonishing number of restaurants in the area. Rooms are cozy, good heat in winter. A really charming hotel. The only cons of this hotel are that it has a very small elevator for less-mobile individuals, and shower stalls are small in SOME of the rooms (not at all unusual in older hotels. But neither of these bothered me, so this is a wonderful hotel at a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Seeart10
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at the Hotel Claude Bernard. As with the other stays the staff was helpful and polite. The location is right in the Latin Quarter and near the metro stops and museums that I like to visit. There were some new rooms and a remodeled space for the breakfast area. There are a variety of room sizes with bathrooms in each room. I look forward to staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: psomoff
Reviews.Content: Hotel Claude Bernard is in a great location. Very close to the Pantheon and Sorbonne, it also is an easy walk to Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter (a great place for cheap fun food). There is a metro station close by which also helps. The hotel itself is very spacious for a European hotel. The room "suite" we were in could easily fit 4 people, we had plenty of room for everyone to spread out (there was 3 or us in the room). There is also a room with a computer if you need internet access. I would stay there the next time I go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice, good value”
Reviews.Author: luciusCanberra
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 10 days at Hotel Claude Bernard in October 2009 and found it an excellent choice. My room was very clean and well maintained and had everything I needed. The hotel is very professionally run and the staff very friendly and helpful. The location is very convenient – only a short walk to the Seine and Notre Dame, and to the Metro and the RER station which has a direct connection to Gare du Nord, Charles de Gaulle, and Versailles. There are good cafes, specialist food shops, small supermarkets, and several excellent bakeries nearby. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean & big rooms, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Ace_gr_7
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean & big rooms. At least the 3-person room we were staying at, was quite large. Excellent location. The staff was very friendly and unlike what some people say or think, they do speak english. Very polite people in the hotel (actually, every French man or woman I spoke to, were gentle). I can think of a thousand reasons to return to charming Paris, and when I do so, I will stay at the same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great! I'll recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: ouragan77
Reviews.Content: The personnel is nice and help us find our way. They also give us adresses of good restaurant and also cheap (not easy in Paris!). I definitely recommend this hotel. We were on the top and had a view from our balcony. It is located next to all transportation and not far from any monument.

Reviews.Title: “Another Lovely Stay at Hotel Claude Bernard”
Reviews.Author: PaulSnood
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 night at the Claude Bernard on Rue Des Ecoles, Paris. It was our second stay there and I'm happy to say everyone was just as great this time as last. The location is INCREDIBLE! We even could see the towers of Notre Dame from our room (#326) overlooking the Rue Des Ecoles (and the wonderful boulangerie across the street). A STEAL at the price for the location and friendliness!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CattieNess
Reviews.Content: For the past several years I have been bringing small groups of tourists to enjoy Paris and have stayed at several of the similarly priced hotels. Hotel Claude Bernard has an exceptional staff who always remember my name and greet my guests as guests in their own home. They offer a lovely French style breakfast, buffet, they actually offer single rooms, there is a refrigerator in your room (not a minibar so you can actually use it), and you are literally a ten minute walk to the Pantheon, Notre Dame and the islands, Musee Cluny, Place St. Michele and Monde Arabique. Even closer is your metro stop (with an outdoor market 3 days TTS a week - fresh fruits and cheese, clothes, etc.), cheese store, wine store and mini-market. And literally outside your door are a couple of restaurants and a bakery/restaurant. There is a Monoprix as well on rue St. Michele. The hotel is in the middle of a refurbishment campaign, and I noted several changes since my last visit with more to come. On my recent visit I shared a lovely 3-bed room with two friends, and it was huge and beautiful. There were three beds (1 double 2 singles), wooden floors and flowered wall paper, a small table and chairs and a desk, plus the refrigerator/cabinet, tv, and closet, typical balcony window/doors. The bathroom had a tub, European style, where the smaller rooms have showers. We loved shopping at the open air market and bringing our treats back to the room for lunch. French rooms and elevators are generally smaller than at home, and this can be a shock for first time visitors. (I advise my guests to just start out using the stairs because in Paris there are more stairs than you have ever seen in your life if you are from California.) Also, there is a heating and air condition unit in the room, and a computer with internet service to check your email and print out your boarding pass. I always feel very safe at Hotel Claude Bernard, which locks up at night, but not to worry, the concierge will let you in if you come wandering in at 4AM.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.”
Reviews.Author: dalemail
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Wonderful time. This hotel may not be for everyone. If you don't mind minor areas of blistered paint or random plaster cracks, this hotel is for you. Great staff. Great location. Great balcony with 180 view! Very clean. Try for room #65. Balcony view includes Notre Dame, Pompidou center and Eiffiel Tower light beam. We love this place!

Reviews.Title: “couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: DrJosepa
Reviews.Content: We have booked this hotel relying on the reviews written in here and we were absolutely delighted. Perfect location, walking distance to RER and Metro stations, even to Notre Dame and Louvre. Near College de France, just in front of Pantheon. A good patisserie across the street. Fluent, english speaking friendly staff. Clean rooms, perfect baths. Towels were refreshed and beds were made everyday. We asked for a double bed but got a twin bed. Ask for a room facing the front side of the hotel. Rooms facing backwards are small and dark. We will be absolutely staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: USALouise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a one-night stay on-line directly with the hotel for an overnight trip from London to Paris. We chose the hotel for its location and price and it was perfect - near the intersection of three hop-on bus tour routes. We arrived early but were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a large room (for four) for the same price. The room was dated but elegant and the bathroom had a full bathtub as well as shower. The continental breakfast was adequate. We spent very little time at the hotel, but I would definitely return there for a longer trip to Paris. We did not speak French, but did not have any problem communicating with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Dissapointed with room”
Reviews.Author: BelfastLiam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Claude Bernard for 4 nights 25th - 29th October 2009. The location of this hotel is excellent - close to all the sights/underground etc. We booked a 4 night stay directly with the hotel, but were extremely dissapointed with the rooms, which were extremely small and in need of major renovation ( Rooms 41&44). We paid 450 euros per room which was obviously a budget price in order to 'fill up' the worst rooms in the hotel. Would only recommend this hotel for its location!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely old hotel, good value and great location -perfect spot to enjoy a visit to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: bey0ndtheblue
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our choice of hotels for our recent first trip to Paris - a perfect location for seeing the sites, as it's close to the the metro, bus and train, and also within reasonable walking distance from the Louvre, Notre Dame, the Cluny Museum, the Pantheon etc. We saved a lot of travel time and some expense by walking to these places directly. The hotel's rooms are bright and clean, with sizable baths and good closet space, as well as a very useful min-fridge for storing fruits and cheeses for picnics and late night snacks. ( A Monoprix store is around the corner and ahandy place to pick up sandwiches, salads, wine, etc if you don't want to eat out for every meal. We also enjoyed going to the street markets on the next block Sat. ,Tues., and Thurs., to get wonderful fruits, pastries, wines, as well as mustards etc that became gifts for friends at home.) Another benefit is the free wi-fi available throughout the hotel as well as a computer room with three desktops and a printer for guests' use - very convenient, especially for checking in for a flight before heading to the airport. Daily continental breakfast included lots of fresh bread and croissants and good coffee - a nice way to start the day with the help of very friendly staff in the kitchen. One note - if you have trouble with stairs, be aware that the breakfast is served a floor below the lobby and, if breakfast is included with your room rate, you'll have stairs to climb daily. The hotel is located on a busy street in the Latin Quarter and you will have street noise, loud on the weekends, if you have a front room. We loved the big windows and balconies and street activity, and soon got used to the noise. The front desk staff could not have been more helpful or responsive to our inquiries and requests. Though we had no problem taking the inexpensive RER train from CDG airport to the hotel on arrival (be prepared for some serious walking!) they helped us reserve an excellent shuttle service to take us and our heavier bags back to our airport terminal for the trip home. The Hotel Claude Bernard is not grand or fancy by Parisian standards, but a lovely old hotel, nicely updated, with a great deal of dignity and charm. It offers great value at reasonable cost, and if you're like us, and would rather spend your money on other things Paris has to offer, then this will definitely be a place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Our room was great, the staff went out of their way to help, location fabulous”
Reviews.Author: nolasoccermom
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay! Our room was very clean and comfortable, location was perfect for sightseeing and going out, view from room was fun. We were so happy we found it. Very fair pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for the Latin Quarter area”
Reviews.Author: mpd4256
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in Paris. The rooms were clean and the management were very helpful. Would stay there again. The location was great for getting around. There were lovely restaurants and shopping in the immediate area. Marilyn, NJ USA

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Rose Red Jewel ...Right in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Anastasia091
Reviews.Content: This is "OUR HOTEL" when we visit Paris. We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else! Great location, just steps away from metro and bus stops. Friendly, courteous, most helpful staff...everyone goes out of their way to assist you. It is charming ...we can experience a stay in a charming, truly French hotel, and for a reasonable price. Nice accomodations and a buffet breakfast is offered daily. What more could one ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: HobbesP
Reviews.Content: I must say I was very disappointed with the hotel after reading the many favourable reviews. The rooms were tiny, not even a bath – smaller than I have had in two star Paris hotels. The bathroom was stained and two plug sockets were hanging loose from the wall. The mini bar was empty and far from being quiet, the Hotel is on a fairly busy road although the traffic was OK at night. The location is very good but make sure you plan a visit to a good restaurant as it is surrounded by low quality tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HarrietJacksonNJ
Reviews.Content: Looking for a Great place to stay, Claude Bernard is the place. Not only is it clean the staff is wonderful. Extremely helpful. Our room on the forth floor facing the front had two twin beds that were very comfortable. The room was a nice size for Paris. Breakfast was included. It had a nice variety and was fresh. Use of a computer was a nice touch. Location was very good, and safe. It is a true find.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent,great location,nice clean rooms,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gmeeei
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Claude Bernard Saint-Germain for 4 nights with our teenage daughters. The rooms are really nice, each one a little different. Nice size very clean very comfortable.The shower stall is a bit small but that is a minor drawback.The location of the hotel is exellent, 7 minutes walk from Notre Dam close to the Panteon, close to public transportation. The staff was very friendy and helpful. There is a tiny elevator that can carry 2 people or one person with a suitcase, but it is better by far than carrying suitcases up stairs

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again if needed a triple room in Paris”
Reviews.Author: humanH1N1
Reviews.Content: After reading much about all those humourous and horirfic reviews about mini sized hotel rooms, we were happy that our triple room ( and bathroom) was quite spacious. However the small cute lift could take only 2 persons and a hand carry bag each time. Its a clean hotel with a helpful and pleasant staff (able to communicate in English). Located in a quiet area,it is quite central as the metro is only 300 m away, The Louvre is 25min , Notre Dam 20 min and the Pantheon 15 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, great accomodation; a hotel to reccomend to your dearest friends”
Reviews.Author: Julia607
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel because of its location and affordable price. But I discovered it had more qualities: it's quiet, clean, staff very friendly and willing to help. Located in the Latin Quartier, very close (walking distance) to a number of great monuments and places to visit in Paris ( Sorbonne, Pantheon and Notre Dame to name the most known of them), a few meters away from metro and bus stations, very well situated if you want to discover the cultural treasures of Paris. Breakfast buffet very good, rooms confortable and clean. The small elevator gives a charm to the hotel. Staff very friendly and make you feel at home. Location in an area full with bistros and shops, so you can get all you need in the neighbourhood. I will surely choose this hotel next time in Paris and strongly recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Canada2see
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed at this excellently located hotel (one block below the Pantheon and two blocks above the Maubert Mutualite metro stop.) The room was clean, the beds were comfortable and the croissants were amazing!!!!!! The hotel is old but had character!!! We got an amazing deal with an internet special!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean comfortable and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: lizzydripping08
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and efficient servce with all reception staff. Upgraded to family room for 4 instead of 3 persons. Room was extremely clean much better than I had expected for this location and price. Just a few hundred Meters from Metro. It was a pleasent surprise to find a/c that was not limited. We last stayed in Ibis hotel near place d Italie and spent a fortune on metro travel as well as wasted time in doing so. Continental breakfast was quite adequate and the croissants were delicious - proper OJ and real good strong tasty coffee. The breakfast manager kept everthing tip top and spotless, and well deserving of the Euro tips that we and a few other people left (not all people had the decency to leave something). I wish I had asked his name but he was very pleasent. About the only -ve was that the decor in our room was a little tired but this was a very minor point. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: badashchick
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice, in consecutive years. In Paris some may find that the French are not always the most kind and helpful to American travellers, however this is not the case at Hotel Claude Bernard. Yummy French breakfasts (croissants and Nutella, mmmm), a warm, comfortable meeting area, even an Business Suite with internet access await you here. If you are looking for an authentic Paris hotel, you have found your place. Throw a rock out of your hotel window and you could hit a patisserie (some of the best eclairs in France), the Sorbonne, or a wine shop. There are several metro stations within a few blocks, allowing you access to anywhere in Paris. Bottom line, I will never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Still recommending this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SlycatAustralia
Reviews.Content: After 2 years - I am still recommending Claude Beanard Hotel - Clean, Staff friendly, breakfast good, staff booked tours for us - safe area - location fantastic - would always stay there -Slycat

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: sundeesman
Reviews.Content: We actially stayed there for a week in 2000. The staff was fantastic. Breakfast was traditionally French (which we loved). There are several great places to dine in less than 3 blocks. We loved it. We are planning another trip to Paris and won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A sweet little room.”
Reviews.Author: DWGriffith
Reviews.Content: We'd never been to Paris so we stopped by for a couple of days on the way to London -- easily done now that the Eurostar whisks you right through the Chunnel. We wanted functional and adequate lodging for this short stay at a short price, and we got it. The hotel is not fancy, but it was clean and roomy and attractive in a wood shop sort of way. They had no booking for their largest room, so they gave it to us without charging more. Within and without the hotel, the Parisians were lovely, encouraging my efforts to speak French, cheering success, switching to English easily when I ran out of words. Do book the breakfast option here! Unlike much of the Latin Quarter, restaurants for breakfast were not plentiful on this block It was nice to just go downstairs and have at the good croissants, brioches, butter and a little cheese. And as proof there is a God and she lives en France, the yogurt was plain, unsugared -- in other words -- food! Location? Formidable! Four blocks uphill: the Paris Pantheon. Four blocks downhill -- Ile de la Cite and Notre Dame! Next door? The Sorbonne! The neighborhood felt like Berkeley! One block east on the corner is a first rate Italian Trattoria, la Pestacore! Bon appetit! Bon soir! Bon nuit!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: drsally
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Claude Bernard in the morning, after 3 days at another hotel, the staff was very nice and stored our luggage for us till our room was ready. This allowed us to spend our day at the Louvre and come back and check in. We were pleasantly surprised by the spacious room on the third floor with TWO balconies and a gorgeous view of the rooftops and the City. The decor in the rooms was bright and very pretty, comfortable beds, the room had two full size beds and a twin, the bathroom was very large too, quite a treat for us after being crammed into a typical small Paris room for 3 days prior. There is a small lift to get your baggage upstairs, they serve continental breakfast in the morning. We loved the location, the next morning they set up a fantastic Farmer's market a couple of blocks away near the Metro entrance, with everything you could think of available fresh! The Sorbonne is only a couple of blocks away and everything is very convenient. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone, especially families.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location - Great for 3 or 4 Traveling Together”
Reviews.Author: msusail
Reviews.Content: We had difficulty finding a room for three on short notice, so we were happy to locate the Claude Bernard. It definitely exceeded our expectations, was clean and a good value. We had room #12 which was quite large by Paris standards. We had one double bed, one twin and another twin that had a twin trundle. Our room also had a small table and chairs where we could enjoy wine (nice wine shop one block away), baguette and cheese after a full day of touring Paris. The location of the hotel is excellent - right across from the Sorbonne and walking distance to many great attractions. There is a metro stop one block away and many nice restaurants close-by. We happened upon several pedestrian streets a few blocks away filled with every ethnic restaurant under the sun that I would suggest checking out. Fun atmosphere! I am sure that the friendly guys at the front desk can direct you there. The breakfast featured croissants, baguettes, toast, yogurt, cheese, coffee, tea and juice. It was a great way to start the day. The servers were very friendly and we were entertained by the French music video channel that the TV was tuned to each day. Another great feature of the hotel is the free wireless internet access and a computer room that also has free access and a printer. Hopefully you don't encounter a rude girl like the one who read my email over my shoulder and commented on it! I can't wait to return to Paris and stay at Claude Bernard again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LucianoBrazilChina
Reviews.Content: Hotel Caude Bernard Saint-Germain is located just a few blocks from Pantheon, Notre Dame, La Chapel, Luxemburg Garden, Sorbone University, concert venues, etc. (on the cultural side); on the gourmet side, the hotel is placed in the Latin Quarter, where you can find great bistros and pubs. It is worthwile to mention that this Claude Bernard has a friendly and always ready-to-help staff, a great place to stay while traveling in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - fiendly helpful staff,”
Reviews.Author: lvboater
Reviews.Content: Very close to Notre Dame, good resturants close by, Clean, The staff was helpful and friendly - would recommend this hotel and would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Small Centrally located hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: deltaqueen
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 65 for 7 nights & didn't realize til nearly the end of our stay that we were actually in the "attic" of this hotel. I expected a small room after reading all the reviews on Trip Advisory (and a few other sights) , but it was adequate with a decent shower, small desk with an older TV & a fridge which came in handy for chilling our wine & keeping our cheese from smelling up the room!! If staying here, I would avoid the 6th floor especially since the elevator only goes to the 5th floor. Having internet access was a plus but it doesn't always work & if in a pinch they will let you use the computer at the front desk. Breakfast was included but a little variety would have been nice. After a week of seeing the same food every morning, even a change in the cheese would have been nice. There were several good restaurants on Rue des Ecoles but with a little wandering either down towards the river or beyond the Pantheon, were several interesting areas to eat. A must do is an evening cruise on the Seine to see the lights, but do this after you have been there a few days so you will recognize the sights as the girl doing the narrating on our boat had limited English. The hotel is close to the bus stops & the metro & catching the RER to Charles de Gaule airport is very close. But it is also within walking distance of most of Paris even from the Arc de Triomph!! A great way to keep those extra pounds off from all the great eating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: occam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best situated in Paris. The area is ideal, quiet, but close to all major sights and some of the cheapest restaurants in city center. There are some nice bars in proximity too. Hotel staff were welcoming, polite and helpful. But there were also some drawbacks: First, the tiny room with the typical moldy smell of Paris hotel rooms. Worst thing was the smell of towels - it was like they were keeping them in a wet cellar for ages. The housekeeping wasn't so good either. I mean, they were cleaning the room every day, but their work wasn't so proficient. The space under the small desk remained uncleaned for the 5 days we were there. I think we paid a lot of money for a room like this. I suppose there are some better rooms in this hotel - but the one we stayed, had nothing to do with those presented on the website's photos. If you want to stay there, ask for a big room. If they don't have, then head to another hotel; there are plenty in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, staff, value”
Reviews.Author: LutetiaDelaware
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Claude Bernard for 6 nights (would've been 8 nights but for a glitch in confirmation, and hotel staff placed us in another great hotel across the street for remaining 2 nights). Nice clean room, very helpful staff, location walking distance to countless historic places and museums (Louvre, d'Orsay, Cluny, Notre Dame, Pantheon, Luxembourg Garden, Sorbonne, etc, etc). Easy access to Metro, RER, bus stops. This was my 6th trip to Paris, and I have to say Claude Bernard was the best place to stay. When we return, we will try to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Annalise123
Reviews.Content: Spent one week here and was surprisingly satisfied with cleanliness, service and overall staff. The rooms are small, but adequate & the shower was good w/ good pressure. Breakfast consisted of croissants, jellies, cereals, cheese, yoghurts & coffee. We requested room on the top floor, 62, and it was very cozy with a million dollar view of Paris rooftops. Great value, great location and Mamout at the front desk was very helpful and always pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “strategic location and very good service”
Reviews.Author: laura586
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a central position and very well located. The rooms are tidy, comfortable and clean and the breakfast in the morning is rich. Personel very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: ozzes
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the service/room/location and value for money.The rooms were very comfortable for us, my in-laws and our two kids.We had two rooms next to each other and a external door that allow us to leave our doors open. The location is very central and in walking distance to RER B ( to Airports) and bus to train station like Gare de Lyon. Will definatly come back to this hotel next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: StudentTraveler97
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Claude Bernard with a group of fellow students. We were taking a French class and so our schedules were a little different from the average traveler. However, the hotel staff was always friendly and accommodating. They made our group feel at home. The rooms were very clean, safe, and came with all the amenities one would expect. The hotel is within walking distance of many great cafes, shops, as well as some fabulous monuments and museums. The neighborhood was a lot of fun to explore. I would recommend the Hotel Claude Bernard to anyone traveling through Paris.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic rooms, great location, very enjoyble stay”
Reviews.Author: WalesPepsi
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in Paris with our two teenage children. We had booked a double and twin room and were given the ground floor suite (rooms 4 and 6) - very impressive, recently refurbuised to a high standard. Even though the rooms were on street level there was very little noise! The breakfast buffet was great and the staff very friendly. Front desk staff very helpful (phoned the station to make sure we could leave our luggage there). The bar was closed but there are plenty of bars and restaurants in the block. The Natural History Museum is a must, our children really enjoyed the morning there, followed by the zoo. We managed all the sights as the hotel in well situated. Wonderful city, will definately return to Hotel Claude Bernard Saint-Germain.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best values in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Dame_Eleanor
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect! Safe area, clean...a wonderful boulangerie (bakery) right across the street. Easy access to the Louvre, and St. Germanin de Pres shopping area. Lots and lots of good places to eat, especially La Perigordine, on the other end of the block! The breakfast buffet at the hotel was great! The hotel staff were friendly, helpful, and courteous. The front desk staff were very good. It was unfortunate that they were in the beginning of renovations, so the bar was closed, but as this was the lowest part of the low season for them, I don't fault them at all for scheduling this when they did. It did not significantly impact our stay one way or the other, and I would be happy to stay there again, any time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: InterimTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Claude Bernard for a month as a student taking a French course and I could not imagine a better hotel experience. The location is ideal, within walking distance of many monuments and museums and surrounded by good restaurants and shopping. The staff was always polite and helpful, regardless of the request, and the rooms were beautiful and clean. Breakfast in the mornings was a great way to stay cost efficient and the wifi internet service was a great way to stay connected while traveling! I would recommend the Hotel Claude Bernard without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SAMASSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Claude Bernard for three nights in early January. Our family of 5 booked the family room on the third floor which consisted of a queen bed and two singles, plus the rollaway (for which they did not charge). Whilst spacious there was little room left for leaving suitcases out. The decor was a little dated but had charm. The room could have done with a little TLC: - knobs were missing off bedside tables, a light globe was out, the TV remote control required batteries and there was nowhere to hang a roll of toilet paper. All minor things. Towels however were fantastic, very generous. Concierge were helpful and friendly prior to our stay and during our stay. We were pleased they accepted a deposit and not the full amount prior to arrival. When the bank took 30 euro from the amount I transferred for the deposit, they graciously offered to split the charge and not ask for the full amount. The lift is claustrophobic and can only fit one person combined with one suitcase or two suitcases on their own at a time. For those looking for the breakfast room please be aware it is underground. Unfortunately, we weren't advised as such when we arrived. However, once we did make the discovery, we enjoyed the usual croissants, jams and coffee. A computer for free internet use is available on the 1st floor, but again we only found out it was there when we asked about internet availability. This hotel is well located and there is plenty around the general area. Pharmacy, ATM and stores such as Monoprix all within a five minute walk. For 50 Euros you could hire a van which fit five of us plus all our bags to get us to Gare du Nord station (15 minutes by car of an early morning). The metro is a good 10 minute walk as was the bus stop for the Le Open Bus Tour (located opposite the Notre Dame). For a family situation, this hotel was excellent value. We would also stay there if on our own without the children. We would recommend this hotel and be happy to stay there again should we be lucky enough to return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Claude Bernard”
Reviews.Author: Mcsquane
Reviews.Content: I've just got back from my 3rd stay at the Claude Bernard - and once again had a great stay. As always the staff were warm and welcoming. There are some renovations going on. The breakfast room is now downstairs so you don't get to watch the Rue d'Ecole waking up around you while enjoying your morning cafe creme. I had a room on the sixth floor. The lift only goes to the fifth floor so if you can't do stairs - beware. The room was a nice double, overlooking the inner-courtyard, and very quiet. But, as I've said a previous post (just like everyone else who has reviewed this hotel), it's location is faultless. I'm already thinking about a trip back in the spring and will most probably be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: PaulSnood
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed four nights at the Claude Bernard Hotel in the Latin Quarter in Paris. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful and the hotel could not have been in a better location, halfway between Notre Dame and the Pantheon. It was the perfect base of operations to explore St.Germain, Ile de Cite, etc and we could walk everywhere, including the Louvre. The hotel could use some work, ie; peeling paint and tattered carpeting. It could also use major soundproofing as you could hear every word in the neighboring rooms and the footsteps above sounded like thunder! Don't take a room near the stairs and elevator! But it was very inexpensive so I really shoudn't complain. The bathroom was very nice and clean and we even had a small refrigerator. Only very limited French TV but who cared. Within 2 blocks the Musee de Moyan Age (highly recommended!) Notre Dame Cathedral (breathtaking) and of course the river. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “Always l'Hotel Claude Bernard for Me”
Reviews.Author: Lavd46
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Claude Bernard at least 8 times in the past 4 years, ranging from 5 days to a little over 2 weeks. I've experienced Christmas in Paris, les Nuits Blanches in October, conferences in April , work assignments, and celebratory events, all made more pleasurable by the realization that I would return to a clean and comfortable room, a welcoming and helpful staff, a simple but more than adequate breakfast buffet, and a hotel in a vital part of Paris that would allow me to wander to well- and lesser known stops without need of the Metro. The Rue des Ecoles in the Latin Quarter has wonderful brasseries (La Petite Perigourdine), restaurants, museums (Cluny) and educational institutions-the Sorbonne, not to mention one of the best frommageries and crepe stands in all of Paris (in my humble opinion).

Reviews.Title: “Pretty room ,, but..”
Reviews.Author: joan1
Reviews.Content: My 12 yr old daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights at beginning of July. We booked a twin room , but were put in a double,, we asked for a twin, were told we would be moved the next day, which we were. ONe thing about the double room , it faced an inner courtyard and was quiet,, little did we know how we would miss it.. The twin room( number 13) we recieved was very very nice. Large for Paris, large window with flower boxes, ,and with a very clean large bathroom, no complaints there. The major issue we had was noise. Do accept this room if noise is something that bothers you. The night desk clerk would stand outside the front door late at night and smoke, this did not bother me , but, what did bother us was his friends often seemed to show up and they would stand out there with him smoking and talking and laughing, loudly,, and we were directly above the front door. Also late at night young people would come down the street singing and yelling, drunk , as if they had just left a nightclub, this usaully ended after about 12:30 ,, I guess this is when the metro stops running. Also, the walls were so thin, we could hear people KEYBOARDING in the computer room across from our roon. I do think the computer room is a nice touch though, it has 3 computers in it and was free to use. Our fridge never worked, and every single day we were told they would fix it tomorrow, they never even came to look at it.. so I gave up.. The front desk staff were nice , and we found the waiter in the breakfast area was nice , if you were polite to him, we noted some people march in and demand coffee without even saying " bonjour monsieur". Would I recommend this hotel, possibly, it was clean, and our twin room was a decent size,, if noise doesn't bother you ,, then perhaps .. Would I stay there again, likely not, just because I know there are so many others I could try, and a few I have tried and would definately want to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Went in with Low Expectations...”
Reviews.Author: yertletheturtle
Reviews.Content: I had certainly done my research of reviews for this property before we arrived and feel that the Hotel Claude Bernard was exactly what I had expected. My husband and I stayed at HCB from June 22 to June 25, 2008 and had a reasonably enjoyable stay. The HCB was located slightly off of a main street, but we were able to find it with our map in hand – not far from the subway station at all. I did not have high expectations for the HCB as it is rated (in most books and web sites) as a three-star hotel. The lobby is a little worn and dated, but is spacious and provides room for lounging if desired. Our check-in was very quick and easy and the staff were very friendly and helpful with making dinner reservations for us at a few restaurants some friends had recommended. Our room was on the third floor, so we did not mind our climb up the winding staircase too much (except one day when we kept forgetting things in our room and had to go back up and down a few times before heading out for the day). We did not attempt to use the small lift as it looked to be more cumbersome to use than just climbing the stairs. We had booked a double room and were a little horrified at first to see our room was literally equipped with only a double bed for the two of us. We’re not used to sleeping on such a small bed, but it actually did not turn out to be a problem as we were both quite tired at the end of each day and had no trouble falling to sleep (the copious amounts of red wine helped as well ; )…). The room was quite small, but standard for Paris, with a desk and chair and a small wall-mounted television. Our room was very clean and well-maintained. We were able to control the air conditioning in our room and it worked extremely well. There was one window which we could open if desired, but our view was only of the building next door across a small alleyway – we had no balcony. This didn’t concern us too much though as we spent most of our time outside on cafes anyway. My only real problem with our room in the HCB was the bathroom – so tiny! The shower stall had shower curtains as walls which made it very difficult to maneuver under the trickle-spray. I have to say I was not able to shave my legs in the shower during our three nights at HCB – sorry Honey!!! Breakfast was included in our stay each morning, and was a nice touch. Juice, hot chocolate, yogurt, cereal, croissant, baguettes, cheeses – a good start to our days in Paris. Just down the street from HCB we discovered La Petite Perigourdine, a small restaurant/café. My husband would sit on the patio and have espresso each morning and we had dinner there twice. The staff were quite friendly (although my husband speaks French, so I don’t know if they would be as friendly to the Anglophones), and the meals were excellent and quite reasonably priced. For approximately 65Eur, we had an appetizer to share, two entrees (lamb and steak tartar), dessert to share and a bottle of nice red wine. I don’t know that I would recommend Hotel Claude Bernard to friends, as I haven’t stayed in other similarly priced hotels in Paris to compare. It was fine for us as we didn’t spend much time in our room and just needed a quiet and clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Accommodations & location”
Reviews.Author: kimberlyj
Reviews.Content: We had a family of 7, we were able to get a triple and a quad room, both rooms located on the 5th floor. Quad room was rather large, both rooms had nice size bathrooms. Rooms have air conditioning and small balcony. The rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable. Location was close to Metro, Sorbonne University, Pantheon, Musée de Cluny, not too long of a walk to the Louvre. Front desk was friendly and accommodating. The guy in the breakfast room got annoyed with us because we wanted coffee before 8:15 a.m. (No coffee pots in rooms). Small elevator - can only hold two people at a time, you get used to it. They offer free internet on the second floor, they have 3 computers in the room. We had breakfast included in our rate, their website special. I am giving this hotel a 4 rating, not because it is exceptionally pretty, but they offer a lot of amenities included in your price. We all slept very well and had a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: smccaughey
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our very first trip to Paris (and to Europe) where we spent five days at the Hotel Claude Bernard on Rue de Ecoles in Paris' Latin Quarter. We booked this hotel based on a recommendations from some friends who had stayed there last year. We were very happy with the hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 10:00 am and were told our room would be ready in an hour. The staff stored our luggage and we set off to do some early sightseeing. In less than 10 minutes we were at Notre Dame. We were so excited to be in Paris we didn't make it back to the hotel for three hours. When we did get back our room was ready. We had room 23 on the second floor with a small balcony that overlooked Rue de Ecoles. The room was a decent size for European standards with two twins which we pushed together. It was very clean with a large bathroom. Some of the decor was a bit tattered and could stand an update, but for all the time you spend in the room while exploring the city, it was really great. We paid $138 Euros a night. We had breakfast included as part of an internet special which was a perfect way to start each morning. Croissants, french bread, cereal, coffee and juice. The staff was very helpful and answered any questions we had on the sites of Paris, directions, etc . I would recommend the Claude Bernard to anyone visiting Paris who doesn't want to spend a fortune on a room. The Latin Quarter is wonderful with lots of great cafes and restaurants close by. We walked everywhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location in Heart of Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: grand dutchess
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a great stay at the Hotel Claude Bernard with eight friends. The location of this hotel was fantastic, right in the heart of the Latin Quarter. You could walk to Notre Dame in 10 minutes, the Lourve and the Musee D'Orsay in 20 minutes. This hotel was very central and close to a major Metro and RER line. You could be anywhere in Paris in no time at all. The room we had was a corner room, Number 56. I highly recommend you request a corner room. It was small but you are not spending anytime in your room. It had twin beds which were very comfortable. The bathroom was a nice size with a tub and hand held shower. The water pressure was great. The room was exceptionally clean. The breakfast was great every morning. Fresh croissants, baguettes, cereal, cheese, yogurt, tea, coffee, and juice. I also want to say that the staff were very friendly and went out of their way to accomodate your every request. Thank you Mamoun, Mohammed, and Pierre. I will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “shocking disaster”
Reviews.Author: Americanonthegogo
Reviews.Content: I spent about 8 daysin Paris in October 2007 during the Rugby World Cup with my best childhood friend as we trekked our way across Europe. We did a lot of research into our hotels, which were booked by a travel agent, and we thought the Bernard was very nice based on the pictures from the internet. Boy, were they misleading. I arrived alone the first night, very late, on a much-delayed flight from Heathrow to find only one staff member on duty and he spoke absolutely no English. As a single woman who travels frequently, I have become accustomed to having help with my bags but no such luck here. After I stuffed myself and all of my heavy bags into the tiny lift, (Thank goodness for a lift), I went upstairs to a hallway that was completely dark to fumble around and find my room, which was totally unacceptable. It was dirty, smelled of smoke, the bathroom shower was moldy and the electrical wires and sockets were hanging out of the walls. I immediatly went downstairs and told the man I could not stay in that room and after using hand gestures for 30 minutes he finally moved me to another room down the hall from the original one. However, there wasn't a key for the room that he was moving me to so he gave me the master key to all of the hotel rooms. How scary is that? Thankfully for all of the other guests, I am not a mass murder pychopath. My second room wasn't any better, but I was exhausted so I toughed it out and slept on top of the covers, in my clothes and prayed that the next day would be better. The next day I spoke to one of the managers and he agreed to move me to a much nicer room on another floor as soon as it was clean. I felt so relieved. My friend made it in that morning and the manager had us leave our luggage with him and he ensured us that by the time we made it back that afternoon, we would already be moved to our new room, which he even gave us the number to. After sightseeing all day, we made it back to find only the French-speaking employee on duty. We stopped to get our room key and he obliged, however, they had put us in the original room they had put me in from the night before with the smoky smell and the sockets hanging out, which was not the room the manager had promised. I was so angry I insisted he call the manager, who spoke Enlish and he apologized that they had given our other room away. Keep in mind we had reservations at the hotel months in advance. At this point I tried to find other rooms in Paris but the rugby cup had them full-up. We decided to tough it out for our remaining days, unhappily, and didn't bother to inform them that I am a writer and they will be recieving some scathing reviews in certain travel mags. Anyways, one night as we got ready to go out, I attempted to plug my converter into an eletrical outlet only to get quite a bad shock because someone had broken their plug off in the outlet and my hand brushed up against it unknowingly. You would think hotels would check for this stuff...when we let them know what had happened, (my friend said smoke came out of the outlet and off of my hand when it happened) the manager didn't really believe us and went up to check it out. He came back looking bewildered, and he too had been electrocuted by the bad plug. Our last day in the hotel, as we waited for our driver, the owner came in and apologized profusly (too late) for all of our troubles and offered us a nice bottle of wine to make up fo it. (Way too little.) He also promised that rennovations were to begin that morning on the two rooms we had been imprisoned to on our stay. To be fair, there were other people there who seemed to really enjoy their stay with the Bernard, but I have to think they had no idea what a nice hotel should be like and how bad they were getting screwed for their money's worth. The only good thing about the hotel is its location is so convenient. Otherwise it is a death-trap of a hotel, which I can't imagine any other experienced traveler, or at least American traveler would find it acceptable. Harsh but so true.

Reviews.Title: “Love at First Sight”
Reviews.Author: OscarTelAviv
Reviews.Content: The Claude Bernard Hotel November 17, 2007 My wife and I visited Paris for 5 days in November. We booked a room at the Claude Bernard Hotel after it was recommended to us by my brother who happened to stay at the hotel after browsing in the internet and finding that the Claude Bernard Hotel fell within his price means and was located in the area he was looking for – the Latin Quarter. We arrived from London at 12:30 noon expecting that our room would be ready at 2:00 (14:00). We intended to leave our luggage there and go for a walk until the room was prepared. The attendant at the counter informed us that the room was ready to be occupied and that we could enter immediately. This was a pleasant surprise as we were in need of a rest. The moment we walked into our double room we fell in love with the place. It was one of the most spacious suites we had ever seen, with a double bed in the middle, a single bed on the side, a couch, a small round coffee table with two chairs, a desk, a small fridge, a large cupboard, a huge washroom with a bath - this was much more than we had expected: A luxurious room that literally took our breath away. The staff was amazingly helpful and gave us a feeling of warmth that made it a pleasure to return every day. The location of the hotel is another one of this hotels great advantages: in the heart of the Latin Quarter, a stones throw from the Sorbonne, a ten minute walk from Notre dam and the Louvre. In fact we found that almost everything we wanted to see was within walking distance, including some fantastic restaurants and a great Jazz club. We will definitely return to the Claude Bernard Hotel. I recommend it to any visitor who appreciates professional competence along with personal warmth that gives the feeling of a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: jessatwest
Reviews.Content: I am a French teacher and went to Paris with my father in June. Unfortunately, the second day that I was there I hurt my back and had to stay in bed for a large part of the day while my father went out sightseeing by himself. He does not speak French and the staff was very helpful to him with their English. They were very concerned for my well-being and had people checking on me throughout the day--they even made me lunch and brought it up! The room that we had was on the small side, but as we come to Paris for sightseeing that isn't really a problem. Even being in bed half the day was doable. The location is great--right around the corner from the Pantheon and Notre Dame. It is extremely safe in this neighborhood. Breakfast is included in the price of the hotel, which is convenient given how expensive the city can be. The staff is a mishmash of ethnicities--Pierre works in the kitchen and is originally from Poland, while Mamoune and Mohammed are from Morocco. Fatima the cleaning lady is from Algeria. They have all been in France for at least 25 years. I suggest that you tip them well, because even though they give excellent service they are still not paid enough to live the lifestyle that we travelers afford while we are on vacation. I know they would appreciate it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good service!”
Reviews.Author: uka
Reviews.Content: We were a group stayed at this hotel from 31.08-03.09.07. The hotel is located in Latin square and with walking distance to Notre dam. The staff at the hotel is extremly service minded and helped us with what ever we asked for and did a great job to make our stay comfortable. There were a slight check-in difficulties but this was solved the following day. The rooms have different sizes, and the twinromm where I stayed was renewed and upgraded. The rooms were cleaned every day. The breakfast is simple but ok. There are lots of restaurants and bars close by. We ate at L'atlas (marrocan food) one evening and it was guite good and with good service. The hotel gave us good prices for the rooms and they were AC-rooms. The lift at the hotel is only suitable to carry your lauggages and we used the stairs or else. There were two metro-stations within walking distance. Travlling with taxies are ok and the prices are resonable. Some drivers did take some extra ride to tax more money. No problems in recommending this 3 star-hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lost I-Pod in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Vlasta50
Reviews.Content: We spent some days in the hotel with our two teenage children. We had reserved two two-persons rooms and at arrival we got one really very spacious room and a very small one. The hotel is very centrally located in the Quartier Latin with many nice restaurants in the neighbourhood and you can do much sightseeing there just by walking. A typical French breakfast is served with good coffee (!), while you have a view on the Parisian streetlife. There is only one very small elevator which makes it difficult to transport all your luggage upstairs. My daughter found out after arriving home that she unfortunately left her I-Pod in the hotel. After ringing to Mohammed he went out to search it (did remember our company), found it in the laundry basket and sent it home! For our next stay in Paris we would consider it visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place!!”
Reviews.Author: AlmaSOceanGrove_NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Claude Bernard Hotel the first week of August. This was our third trip to Paris and the second stay at this hotel. I must admit, when I saw postings saying the AC was out, I was a bit worried; so much so that I called the hotel directly and was assured the air conditioning was fine. In fact, it was better than fine; we slept in cool comfort every night. The rooms are a bit small, but very clean and well maintained. The elevator is very small; it supposedly holds 2 people, but we never felt comfotable enough to test it. The staff is absolutely the best; when we made a mistake in our reservations ( didn't show up the first night we had booked), instead of telling us that our reservation was gone, Mohammed at the front desk quickly found us a room and then moved us to better quarters the second night. Everyone was incredibly helpful with Metro and bus directions, restaurant reservations and general Parisian information. We told them to be ready for us in 23 months, for we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: AtlasNY
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in the Claude Bernard Hotel in July. Being that it was our first time in Paris I was worried where I would be staying. Well it turned out the the Claude Bernard is a great 3-star hotel. Although its not fancy or the rooms might not be that big it makes up for it in other ways. The hotel was clean, the air-conditioner worked well in my room, and every morning they gave a great breakfast. The location is great, in which the bus stop is directly across the street and the Metro is 1 block down. It is also walking distance to plenty of great restaurants and shopping. Notre Dame and the Seine is within a few blocks. Also Mohammed at the front desk was extremely nice and helpful everyday. We would tell him what we would like to see and he would tell us exactly which bus or train to take and in the evening suggest a nice restaurant to eat at. So if in Paris and just looking for a reasonably priced & clean hotel I would recommend the Claude Bernard.

Reviews.Title: “quaint little hotel- will definitely visit again!”
Reviews.Author: honey118832000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was on a very quiet street in the latin quartier and very close to many metro entrances. The staff was very hospitable and helped with anything we needed. The rooms were reasonably sized and very clean. The lift is only suitable for one person at a time though. There were many restaurants within walking distance as well, La Petit Perjourdine was my favorite located right down the street. I would recommend this to any tourist staying in Paris on a budget and wanting to be close to many of the popular tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris!”
Reviews.Author: ES_Sci_Educ
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, great room. For the money, a great value. The room was clean, the staff polite and helpful, and access to most attractions and public transportation are easy. My only regret is that we were not planning on staying longer. We would stay here again and recommend it to our friends. One cautionary note - the elevator does not go to the top floor, and is not much larger than a closet - a very small one at that!

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed here three times”
Reviews.Author: TravelKitty21
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on three occasions and each was a different experience. My first stay was in march of 2002, I came with my class for a spring break trip. The staff was wonderful, except they understandably grew weary of the large groups gathered in the quite small lobby. The hotel was clean and the breakfast was delightful! My second stay was in June of 2004. The hotel was perfect! I was on a family vacation and they were quite accommodating. The staff always had a helpful suggestion on where to eat and what time would be best to see certain attractions. So of course I booked the same hotel just last march and it was as if I were in a completely different hotel. I had given so much praise to this hotel that it was quite a disappointment. My train was delayed and I was and five hours late checking in ( I had called ahead to make certain our room would still be held). My friend and I arrived around 10 p.m. The had downgraded our room ( I had reserved a large room with a bath) and when I asked the gentleman at the desk if he knew of anywhere we could grab a quick dinner. He just looked up and said "I don't know." That seemed to be the theme through the rest of my stay! No one was helpful like usual. When we came down for breakfast the table was nearly empty and the staff did not hurry to replace missing items. ( Which was a disappointment because they charge 10 euro for breakfast). The day we checked out they did not give a wake up call (which caused us to miss our train back to London) and at checkout we were still charged for the larger room we had booked. And we had booked that at an lower Internet rate that we weren't given! And one last insult came when no one could be bothered to call us a Taxi! I don't know what went wrong but I have been reading reviews for people whom are saying the same thing about the decline in customer service from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “quaint, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wohlfies
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days, June 16-20. We had a wonderful stay. Our room for our family of 4 was clean, good-size with air-conditioning ( did cover up street noise on Sat. night), refrigerator,and a nice bathroom. The weather was nice and we were able to pick up our Starbucks( 2 locations, 5 min. away) chai teas and sit on our balcony and enjoy. The location is perfect. A short walk to the Metro, Boul Mich', Sorbonne, Pantheon, Seine, Notre Dame...Eric Kaiser bakery and lots more. The Coupe-Chou Restaurant (fantastique for couples, we left the kids in the room) was just behind the hotel. The staff was extremely helpful. Laundromat was 1 min. away, very handy. Breakfast was plentiful and enjoyable in the breakfast room. They also had free internet in the lobby which was a treat that we did not have anywhere else in France. My 16 yr. old son was ecstatic to check his Fanstasy baseball. We would definitely go back and my family is picky.

Reviews.Title: “Ah Paris!”
Reviews.Author: ade_jeff
Reviews.Content: We spent a pleasant week in Paris at Claude Bernard Hotel. The hotel is well situated about three blocks from Notre Dame and we had no problem walking every where. Breakfast was fine, and we were pleased with the excellent service we received from the front counter staff who were always willing to answer questions and help in any way they could. We would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No A/C & Noise Makes for Long Nights”
Reviews.Author: JudgeDee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel earlier this month, largely because it was supposed to be air conditioned. There was no A/C in the hotel when we got there and there was no estimate as to when such might exist 3 days later when we left. Then again no one seemed to be working on it and management didn't seem at all concerned about its absence. The evenings were cool by our standards but the rooms remained very warm and stuffy. Opening the windows helped but we found it too noisey to sleep. Our room had a small fan which helped a bit but my kids' room had none. Not a big deal that the rooms were a bit more dumpy than I expected. We were on a floor that had been added-the others we saw were smaller and more aged. On the plus side the desk clerks were friendly and we liked the location. I can go with minimal sleep but my wife and kids don't function as well on little rest so it definitely detracted from our sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location - nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sacto71
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Claude Bernard last month. Really great location, three metro stops within a 10 min walk, you can walk up to Notre Dame as well. Several shops and restaurants as well. The hotel was a good choice, would stay again, however would need to specify location of the room. They promised last fall when we booked the room, all rooms have A/C. When we arrived and fell in love with our 5th floor, corner room ( room 56), two balconies, lovely view..... we were a bit upset the A/C had "not been installed on your floor yet". So they brought us a fan and luckily it was far from hot during our stay. Bathroom was great, plenty of hot water and great water pressure. Mini fridge was a plus, pillows were not so great but I've found most of Europe to be that way. All and all it was a great stay with very helpful staff and a wonderful breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “great location, except on June 21”
Reviews.Author: yankeemama
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Claude Bernard for one night in June 2006. The location was great, right near the Metro, within easy walking distance of Notre Dame and the Louvre. Our only problem was that the portable air conditioning unit for our room had a water hose that had to go out through the door to the balcony, so if you wanted the air conditioning on (and we were on the 5th floor so it was hot) you couldn't close the doors all the way. We happened to be there on June 21, when there is a city-wide music festival that goes until 1 am. We had been up since 5 that morning flying in from Sweden, so we were exhausted, and with the doors open the room was too noisy to sleep. Even with the air conditioning shut off and the doors closed it was difficult to sleep. I would not recommend staying near the Sorbonne on June 21, unless you stay up late and like very loud music. They also charged us more for the breakfast than they initially stated, and would not adjust the rate upon checkout. I emailed them later, but never got a reply.

Reviews.Title: “The Nicest Best Priced Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: carolinecabell
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Claude Bernard is the perfect choice for Paris sightseeing. Only 2 blocks form Notre Dame and 6 blocks form The Louvre you can never get lost. The staff is so thoughtful and generous that you will want to come back again. I have stayed there 3 times in 4 years and loved it every time. The same people have been working there and they remember me each time I come! The breakfast is lovely and so are the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Location was Great!”
Reviews.Author: atldawg79
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through a travel agent as part of a 3 city Europe trip. Our visit was in March 2007. Even though we don't know exactly how much the stay cost us we were very pleased. We spent three nights at Claude Bernard. The location is superb for dining and touring. It is a few blocks from the underground but within walking distance of many sites. The area was very safe at night and even though directly on a street quiet for sleeping. One complaint was the walls are paper thin and we heard everything the people in the next room was saying. Needless to say we stayed quiet in our room so they didn't have any stories to tell on us. The rooms are small but very clean. The marble bathroom was roomy and very adequate. The breakfast was sufficient to get you through to the afternoon. The free internet is a plus in the lobby to stay in touch via email. Be prepared to walk the steps to your room unless you don't mind the elevator which only fits one person comfortably. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big Mistake!”
Reviews.Author: Bluemink
Reviews.Content: We had previously enjoyed a pleasant stay at this hotel the previous year and so decided to book our Easter 4 night break well in advance. Our Eurostar train was seriously delayed but we phoned ahead to confirm our late arrival. We eventually arrived after 1.30am to be told 'due to a problem with hot water' our room was unavailable and we were to take our luggage across the road to the Hotel California where we would have to stay the night. No assistance was offered or indeed any further explanation. After struggling with our bags we managed to make it up to a room I can only describe as sub-standard. At this point we were so exhausted we felt there was little point in unpacking so we collapsed in to bed to try and catch up on some sleep. At 9am the following morning, the receptionist told us to return to The Claude Bernard to have breakfast. After carting our bags back to the Hotel, we were then told that our room would not be available till noon as the occupants had not yet checked out. It transpires the story of the 'hot water' was just that, a story and the reason we were 'unceremoniously' dumped across the road was due to one of their 'frequent' over-booking policies. The surly man on reception was downright rude and said if we didn't like it we could go and find somewhere else to stay! If this is the hotels policy then I don't see how anyone can risk booking in advance to then be given sub-standard accommodation at the same price and no apology! On such a short break we wasted our precious time hanging around waiting for a room. We were given a smaller twin room than our previous visit and also charged the full rate, not the discount rate we were told at the time of booking. Our 2nd but definitely our last visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, people and price”
Reviews.Author: mmed
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! The staff is helpful, the rooms are clean and the location is great. Walking distance to Notre Dame, Pantheon, Sarbonne, Latin Quarter, but still in a rather quiet area. The room was on the small side, but had a mini-fridge and was all updated. Free internet in the lobby. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. For a splurge, try the restaurant behind them (just up the hill with all the fireplaces).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: SMCorreia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Claude Bernard on our recent trip to paris in early November. We had never been to Paris before, and were so glad to have chosen a hotel in this location (bordering Latin Quarter and St. Germain Du Pres). We walked everywhere, but the Metro was also super easy and extremely close to the hotel. Also TONS of great restaurants in the area (our favorite was Allard). The gentlemen who worked the front desk were alwasy very helpful with directions and reservations. The rooms are very clean (if basic) and provided us with a very pleasant stay! I woulg highly recommend this hotel for the location first and foremost, and value second.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant second stay at Claude Bernard”
Reviews.Author: NolaCooke2162
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a second stay at the Claude Bernard, an unpretentious but conmfortable three star hotel right in the heart of the Latin Quarter. The first time I was alone, and was given a tiny converted attic one flight above where the elevator stopped, which was fine for one and had a great bathroom. This time my husband was also along, and we were given a large and comfortable room overlooking the street on two sides, with a good bathroom for the standard of hotel. The manager, Paul, is friendly and truly helpful, there is free broadband interent in the lobby, and the breakfast includes (self-boiled) eggs and cheese, so is hearty enough for those who like something more substantial than a croissant and bread. Asd as a returning guest I was able to negotiate a complimentary breakfast for us both, which made the cost quite economical as well. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Claude Bernard”
Reviews.Author: TangoGirl
